, Cited by

]

Patna High Court - Orders

Ram Pravesh Mahto @ Ram Pravesh Mahato vs The State Of Bihar on 1 December, 2023

Author: 
Sunil Kumar Panwar

Bench: 
Sunil Kumar Panwar

 IN THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT PATNA
 CRIMINAL MISCELLANEOUS No.76429 of 2023
 Arising Out of PS. Case No.-412 Year-2023 Thana- KANTI District- Muzaffarpur
 ======================================================
 Ram Pravesh Mahto @ Ram Pravesh Mahato Son Of Bilas Mahto R/O
 Village- Bakatpur, P.S.- Kanti, District- Muzaffarpur

 ... ... Petitioner/s
 Versus
 The State of Bihar

 ... ... Opposite Party/s
 ======================================================
 Appearance :
 For the Petitioner/s : Mr.Hari Kishore Thakur
 For the Opposite Party/s : Mr.Anuj Kumar Shrivastava
 ======================================================
 CORAM: HONOURABLE MR. JUSTICE SUNIL KUMAR PANWAR
 ORAL ORDER

2 01-12-2023
 Heard learned counsel for the petitioner and learned

 APP for the State.

 The petitioner has prayed for grant of bail in

 connection with Kanti P.S. Case No. 412 of 2023 registered

 under 
sections 304B
, 
201
 and 
34
 of the Indian Penal Code.

 It is a case of dowry death of the informant's daughter

 due to non-fulfillment of dowry demand.

 Learned counsel for the petitioner submits that the

 petitioner is innocent and has committed no offence. The

 petitioner is father-in-law of the deceased due to which he has

 falsely been implicated in this case. He has no concern with

 mess and business of the deceased as well as from her husband

 and also he lives separately from them. Moreover, the petitioner

 is languishing in judicial custody since 07.06.2023.
 Patna High Court CR. MISC. No.76429 of 2023(2) dt.01-12-2023

 2/2

 The application for bail is opposed by learned APP for

 the State.

 Having heard learned counsel for the parties and

 considering the facts and circumstances of this case as well as

 the custody of the petitioner, the Court is inclined to enlarge the

 petitioner on bail. The above named petitioner is directed to be

 enlarged on bail in connection with Kanti P.S. Case No. 412 of

 2023 furnishing bail bond of Rs. 10,000/- (Rupees ten thousand)

 with two sureties of the like amount each to the satisfaction of

 the learned J.M. 1st Class, Court No-6, (West) Muzaffarpur.

 (Sunil Kumar Panwar, J)
Shubham/-

U T

 CORAM: HONOURABLE MR. JUSTICE SUNIL KUMAR PANWAR

2 01-12-2023
 Heard learned counsel for the petitioner and learned
APP for the State.
The petitioner has prayed for grant of bail in
connection with Kanti P.S. Case No. 412 of 2023 registered

under 
sections 304B
, 
201
 and 
34
 of the Indian Penal Code.
It is a case of dowry death of the informant's daughter
due to non-fulfillment of dowry demand.
Learned counsel for the petitioner submits that the
petitioner is innocent and has committed no offence. The
petitioner is father-in-law of the deceased due to which he has
falsely been implicated in this case. He has no concern with
mess and business of the deceased as well as from her husband
and also he lives separately from them. Moreover, the petitioner

is languishing in judicial custody since 07.06.2023.
 Patna High Court CR. MISC. No.76429 of 2023(2) dt.01-12-2023
The application for bail is opposed by learned APP for
the State.
Having heard learned counsel for the parties and
considering the facts and circumstances of this case as well as
the custody of the petitioner, the Court is inclined to enlarge the
petitioner on bail. The above named petitioner is directed to be
enlarged on bail in connection with Kanti P.S. Case No. 412 of
2023 furnishing bail bond of Rs. 10,000/- (Rupees ten thousand)
with two sureties of the like amount each to the satisfaction of
the learned J.M. 1st Class, Court No-6, (West) Muzaffarpur.

(Sunil Kumar Panwar, J)
Shubham/-
U T
